intro: Limodorum lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceleaf lily of the valley, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asparagaceae. It is native to the forests of Europe and parts of Asia, where it thrives in shaded, moist environments. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fragrant flowers are often used in perfumery and traditional medicine. Limodorum lanceolatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
